name: High Beeches B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is amazing, our room was great, breakfast was plentiful, and even the dog was friendly! Ian and Ali were very accomodating, with good suggestions for parking just outside of Bath (bring lots of coins -- 10 hours of parking at the cricket club cost about 13 pounds!), as well as restaurants and sightseeing. Our room was spacious compared to many other UK B&Bs we visited, with a very comfortable bed and a good shower. Bath was a wonderful place to visit and our stay at High Beeches made it even better.
reviews.title: Wonderful Bath area B&B

reviews.text: I was there for the Bank holiday weekend. Charming place - the bedroom was comfortable, the breakfast was good, and it would have been a pleasent stay but for one factor:
reviews.title: Forgiving would have made the stay divine

reviews.text: The house is not new, and I believe the flooring is wooden. So, unless you trend softly, the sound carries through the house. I did not know this, having been in England just a few days. So, when I was up at 7, I apparently woke up the owner as well. He mentioned it to me when we met, and I apologised. However, following that, each person he met, he insisted on repeating the fact that he was having a rough time because I woke him up. If the owner values his sleep and comfort so highly, he shouldn't be renting his place out.
reviews.title: Debbie S
The perfect B&B for our visit to Bath
reviews.text: The lady of the house (Ali) was very pleasent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed with Ian and Ali before but this was our first visit to High Beeches and, once again, we were made very welcome. The house has a lovely family atmosphere, all the rooms are a good size, clean and beautifully furnished. We were a family group visiting Bath for a family wedding and we all had extremely comfortable beds with luxurious bedlinen. Breakfast was also very good and served in a very friendly and homely manner - not at all starchy or brisk like some B&B's. Over and above all the comfort we experienced, it was the welcome of the hosts, Ali and Ian, who made our visit very special. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Pleasant and welcome stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was wonderful and the bed was extremely comfortable. The rom and bathroom were very clean. We had a car and it was a short drive to the center of Bath. The house is beautiful and cozy. I had a great stay and highly recommend this place. The breakfast served in the morning was amazing. I am still craving it til this day. The hosts were very responsive and communicative and helpful with tips and advice. When I return to Bath I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Bath

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a Friday and Saturday night in this B&B and had a lovely time. We booked room 1 and are so glad we did, it is a beautiful room. There is a huge bed which is sooooo comfortable! The huge windows overlook the countryside and there is a big window seat which was just as comfortable as the bed! The bathroom was lovely with a big double shower, and it was lovely and powerful, which I always look for in a shower. We only had breakfast on one of the mornings as we had a sleep in the 2nd day. Breakfast was lovely, really tasty bacon and eggs. And a cafetiere of coffee, much more appreciated than instant coffee! Ian was very friendly and helpful, very much made us feel welcome. We did not see much of Ali due to her broken leg but the time we did see her she was very friendly and again helpful with advice of places to go. There is a bus stop very nearby which takes you right into the centre of Bath but if you are going to go there and back more than once in a day, get a day pass as it works out much cheaper. Parking is slightly difficult at the B&B as there is not a huge amount of room however we didn't need our car all weekend as we used the bus so Ian put it in the garage and we were able to leave it there all weekend which was great. We went on one of the wettest weekends of the year but it didnt bother us at all as we had a lovely B&B to return to after a very soggy day! All in all, a great weekend and would definitely recommend and stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable room and lovely hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in early June and found it to be excellent. It's a short drive to Bath but I'm told the public transport is fine if you don't have a car. Ian is an excellent host and his breakfast was superb. The rooms were very comfortable with large double beds and serviceable toilets. The best thing about this place is that it was perfect balance between the familiarity and coziness of a B&B with the anonymity of a hotel. We'd definitely stay here if we ever make it to Bath again!
reviews.title: Everything you want in a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on a vacation in April and couldn't recommend it more. Ian was the consummate host. He took time to explain the area and recommend things to do and places to go for the best views and most interesting things. In addition, he cooked us delicious traditional English breakfasts all 3 of the mornings that we were there. He said that was unusual for Americans coming through, and that they usually only do that once or twice, but he happily obliged.
reviews.title: Excellent - warm, informative and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The warm, comfortable home is a bit of a walk from the center of Bath, but it's a picturesque walk, and the very clean and reliable busses pick up just down the street if you'd rather ride to town, so there was no problem with any inconvenience. Plus, by being a little way out of town, you are right on the edge of the Cotswolds, which is breathtaking.
reviews.title: A pleasant suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our 2 weeks roundtrip through southwest Enland High Beeches was our first stay for 3 days. The location is really outstanding on a hill 3 miles from city centre. All rooms have their own very personal flair with very tasteful furniture and bright and modern bathrooms. A pub ist only 300yards away and a bus line near the house can bring you to city centre directly.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in an extraordinary B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are always willing to give helpful tips and recommendations for sight seeing highlights or eating out. That B&B is absolutely recommendable.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on our honeymoon for two nights and wished we could have extended it longer. The room we stayed in was brilliant, really spacious and wamly furnished. It just felt so comfortable. Not to mention clean! Ian and Ali were fantastic hosts, very friendly and helpful with advice on where to eat and what to do around the area. Ian really went out of his way to help us as we were arriving late. Such genuine people and such a beautiful house. We cannot wait to get back to Bath and stay here again!
reviews.title: High marks for High Beeches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: High Beeches B&B is everthing that English hospitality should be about. The hosts, Ian and Ali, were fantastic. They not only provided a great breakfast and a clean, comfortable room, but they were extremely helpful for location attractions, restaurants, and "must-see" places. We booked the largest room, and found it to be spacious and more than adequate. The bathroom was also large (for European standards). Their location was just far enough out of downtown Bath to give you a peaceful, countryside feel, but close enough to be downtown in minutes. I can recommend this without reservation!
reviews.title: High Beeches was great!!

reviews.text: Great location, AWESOME owners! Loved it. Hosts were kind, courteous, and made our stay enjoyable and comfortable. Rooms were clean and nicely furnished. Highly recommend it. Will definitely stay there again if / when we go back. Everything we thought a B&B should be.
reviews.title: Wish a longer stay

reviews.text: After arriving from a 20+ hour flight, Ian welcomed us with warm wishes and sound advice to fight through the jet lag and stay up by walking to a nearby pub for dinner and then an idealic village nearby. The start of great advice which we followed for our 2-day stay. The B&B and the amazing breakfast to order he served us each morning impressed upon us the hospitality of the English. Ian went out of his way to help us whenever we asked and made for a wonderful start of our stay in England. Thanks.
reviews.title: A warm welcome....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Awesome owner, Ian, went out of his way to make our time spent in Bath a great experience.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accomodation: large room, lovely decorated with comfortable bed and spacious bathroom
reviews.title: B&B at it's best

reviews.text: Hospitality: Ian and allison gave us a warm welcome and cared for helpful advice and delicious full english breakfast :-)
reviews.title: Gorgeous guesthouse in a beautiful location close to the centre of bath

reviews.text: Location: half an hour walking distance from the city with great viewpoints - to sum it up: we would love to come back
reviews.title: A very pleasant guest house and experience.

description: High Beeches offers: ETC Quality in Tourism Four Star Guest Accommodation Genuine hospitality in a great location Three extremely well equipped Triple/ double/single rooms with super king/twin and king size beds all with en-suite shower rooms Deliciously cooked traditional English breakfast or continental if prefered Private off-street parking and garaging (if available) Courtesy pick up/drop off from Railway & Bus station (Please arrange in advance) Free Internet access via Wi-Fi for guests with their own computers or access via High Beeches PC High Beeches is situated on the Southern edge of Bath surrounded by glorious countryside, in an area of outstanding natural beauty but only a short distance from the centre of Bath with the rolling countryside and village of Southstoke behind us. We are located between the main campuses of the University of Bath and Bath Spa University with the MOD Foxhill offices, Bath Clinic, Wessex Water, Prior Park and Monkton Combe School all very close.
